ReviewList.Text: For those of you who gave this book one star because it contained a list / brief description review of SF books, it is a common practice in genre fiction (Westerns, fantasy, SF, major literature etc.) to compile a "best of" list.  While such a list is no better than the taste and education of the compiler (which varies enormously) such a list -- even a mediocre one -- is often very useful when one is trying to decide which of perhaps thousands of books in a genre (note:  I give this book five stars for its function and usefulness, not for the particular quality of the choices or reviews).  It makes the reader aware of what is "out there" and what others consider good or otherwise noteworthy.  I am curious as to why these readers think a 290 page book would contain the *complete* text of a hundred novels.  A certain minimal intelligence is needed here.  Dissatisfied buyers -- presumably SF readers -- should use this book as intended. They should find it useful.  RDB
A great collection of critical essays showing the vast range of odeon science fiction. A whole new list of must reads.

The authors really know their stuff, but the writing is just atrocious. A good edit would have made this book readable, but right now it's just one tortured, incomprehensible run-on sentence after another, which diminishes the pleasure of discovering new SF novels.

This is a reference work about the 101 novels. I wanted to read some of the best science fiction novels but did not know where to start. Some historical and literary information is given about each novel. A lot if information is given about authors in this genre and I was able to choose some authors that sound interesting and can look for more works from them. It is great to read about them and decide what I really want to read.
Wonderful collection of stories by the masters in the field, assembled in a handy volume.  Nice to revisit old favorites and to find some great tales previously missed.  Highly recommended.
Love scifi anthologies, feels like you get a taste of different authors all in one publication. Will look for these types again.
This presents snippets and full stories from the beginning of speculative fiction to the present. It's amazing to see how the genre has bloomed.
This book is an excellent way to learn about sf titles that are well-respected and for potential future reading.
I am trying to learn how to write Science Fiction. This is a good place to review earlier successful stories.
This also was not expected.  I did not like that it was only a review of novels.

This book is okay of its type, but I was really looking for an anthology and got collected criticism/description.  I would have rated t higher had it been a little more expansive. Both of these things are probably my fault, but had I researched the book properly I wouldn't have bought it.
It has too many very old stories - from 40's even.  Some obviously written for general market then change 'country' to 'planet', 'airplane' to 'space ship', and you have "Science Fiction"....
This is simply a list of the 101 best SciFi novels.  It is not something you should pay for.
This book - "Science Fiction: The 101 Best Novels" - does NOT contain novels. It contains only reviews. Very disappointing.
Expected an anthology of stories, either complete or abridged editions, not a collection of book reviews!  Very, very, very disappointed!

Why would anyone want to read about someones impressions of the 100 best books?  I sure don't.  I guess I mislead myself thinking this is a great buy...100 books (many I've not read...many more by authors I would not be likely to read) for a very low price.  Especially when amazon does provide many fine books at zero cost or 99 cents for the electronic version.

I want to read about the book being reviewed, not the history of everything the author ever wrote and every book like the book they are reviewing.  Also, I want to know how many pages the darn thing is. Isn't that a consideration for lots of readers?  Finally, I want my reviews in simpler language. If I want reviews I have to study to understand, I will look in the NY Times.
The title is misleading. You might think you are getting 101 stories but all you get are one page reviews of the stories.
